'We didn't keep Sachin Tendulkar waiting': Growing calls for Vaibhav Suryavanshi's early India call-up
description: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, stunned the cricketing world with a record-breaking 175 in the U19 World Cup final, leading India to victory. His performance has reignited the debate on fast-tracking young talents, with Shashi Tharoor drawing parallels to Sachin Tendulkar. However, ICC regulations prevent Sooryavanshi from playing international cricket until March 2026.

title: 75+ Happy Teddy Day Messages, Greetings, Wishes and Quotes for 2026
description: Valentine's Week continues with Teddy Day on February 10, celebrating love's nurturing side through gifting teddy bears. This gesture symbolizes care and comfort, ideal for expressing affection, especially for those in long-distance relationships or seeking to reconnect. The article offers various wishes, messages, and quotes to convey these sentiments.

Anthropic exec Mrinank Sharma announces exit, shares long resignation note
description: Mrinank Sharma, head of Anthropic's Safeguards Research Team, has resigned, with his last day being February 9th. Sharma cited a desire to contribute with full integrity and explore essential questions, including poetic truth alongside scientific truth. He plans to pursue a poetry degree and focus on courageous speech and community building.

‘Historically new level’: US cuts tariffs on Bangladesh to 19% under new trade deal
description: The United States and Bangladesh have inked a new trade pact, lowering tariffs on Bangladeshi exports to the US to 19%. This agreement, hailed as a significant step, also introduces zero reciprocal tariffs for specific textile and apparel shipments made with US cotton and man-made fibers.

title: Cocaine seller flew under the radar till fake currency he deposited at PNB branch gave him away
'Jana Nayagan' censor fight moves to final stage: Vijay fans react
description: ‘Jana Nayagan’ has been stuck in a long censor fight. The film was supposed to release on January 9, 2026. But the CBFC asked for cuts and then paused the process again because of some concerns about army scenes and religious points. This made the producers upset. They went to the Madras High Court asking for quick certification. The court looked into the case, but nothing moved fast. Now the producers have changed their mind. They do not want to fight in court anymore. They told the court that they want to withdraw the case. The petition is now listed “for withdrawal” on February 10, 2026. This means the legal path is ending. The CBFC revising committee can now check the film without any break. Fans are watching everything closely. Many fans are asking for updates online. Some are hopeful. Some are frustrated because the film has been delayed for a whole month. But everyone is waiting for the next big step. The next confirmed update will come only from the CBFC. The movie’s fate now depends on the revising committee’s decision.

title: Kashmir defies nature: Tulips bloom in December for first time, months ahead of spring

title: Bassist Fred Smith passes away at 77
description: Veteran bassist Fred Smith, a pivotal figure in the rise of punk rock and new wave, has died at 77. Known for his work with Television and Blondie, Smith was celebrated for his melodic basslines and essential contributions to songs. His bandmate Jimmy Rip shared heartfelt tributes, remembering Smith's humor and musical talent. Smith passed away from cancer complications.

title: Over 18,700 government schools in State have no land records

description: Recommendations by the eight-member committee is not yet made public

Trump threatens to bar the new U.S.-Canada bridge from opening, demands talks with Ottawa
description: Trump has made a number of threats against Canada in his second term and drastically hike tariffs on the U.S. northern neighbor

title: Former child actor Blake Garrett passes away at 33
description: Former child actor Blake Garrett, celebrated for his role in 'How to Eat Fried Worms,' has passed away at 33. His mother confirmed his death in Tulsa, Oklahoma. While the cause is under investigation, he had recently been diagnosed with shingles. Garrett, who began his acting journey at eight, also appeared in 'Barney's Colorful World, Live!' and various stage productions. Some of his stage productions include 'Grease' and 'Peanuts: A Charlie Brown Tribute.'

Player with many appearances for Pakistan called as Jasdeep's replacement
description: USA fast bowler Jasdeep Singh has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup 2026 with a shoulder injury sustained during a warm-up match against New Zealand. The ICC approved former Pakistan player Ehsan Adil as his replacement. Jasdeep, a key USA bowler with 54 ODI and 31 T20I wickets, was part of their historic 2024 World Cup win over Pakistan. His absence is a big setback for the team.

Border 2 box office day 18, 19 live: Sunny Deol film tops Rs 426 crore worldwide
description: 'Border 2', featuring the dynamic duo Sunny Deol and Varun Dhawan, is approaching the final curtain call in theaters, with box office numbers tapering off in its third week. Set against the backdrop of the 1971 war, it gathered Rs 1.85 crore on its 18th day, culminating in a domestic total of Rs 311.60 crore. Read on to know more.

title: National interest will guide how India sources its energy: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri
GSDP growth of State has outpaced national average, says planning official
description: Andhra Pradesh’s GSDP is estimated at ₹17.62 lakh crore, reflecting a growth of 10.75%, says State Planning Department Principal Secretary Piyush Kumar

title: AR Rahman opens up about his diet, says he has been off sugar for a decade: ‘…not even an occasional gulab jamun?’
Shami, Ishan Kishan among five players dropped from BCCI central contracts
description: The BCCI's central contracts for 2025-26 see several prominent names like Mohammed Shami and Ishan Kishan excluded, with the A+ category abolished. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are moved to Group B, while Shubman Gill enters Group A alongside Jasprit Bumrah and Ravindra Jadeja. Sai Sudharsan is the sole new male entrant.

title: Indian-origin techie from Karnataka shot dead in daylight attack at Canada mall
description: A 37-year-old Indian tech professional, Chandan Kumar Raja Nandakumar, was killed in a daylight shooting in Toronto. The incident occurred at a busy shopping mall parking lot. Police are investigating the shooting as a targeted attack. Chandan's family in Karnataka is devastated. He had moved to Canada six years ago and worked for LTI Mindtree.

title: U.S. trims tariffs on Bangladesh to 19%
description: Bangladesh’s key export-earning ready-made garments made from cotton and synthetic fibres imported from the U.S. would enjoy zero reciprocal duty under the deal, says Commerce Secretary Mahbubur Rahman

title: Bullet train project: Railway Board directs NHSRCL to prepare DPRs for seven new high-speed rail corridors
Fire breaks out at Faridabad’s Eros Garden society, no casualties
Eritrea calls Ethiopia’s accusations of military aggression ‘deplorable’
description: Ethiopia accused Eritrea over the weekend of military aggression and of supporting armed groups inside their territory, where recent clashes between Tigrayan forces and Ethiopian troops have raised

title: Why is there a caste-system for trains, asks PAC
description: A BJP member pointed out that there appears to be a “caste system” in trains, with premium services such as the Vande Bharat offering superior linen and cleaner coaches compared to regular passenger trains

title: Naveen Patnaik attacks Mohan Majhi government over paddy procurement
description: Thousands of farmers are spending sleepless nights under the open sky, guarding their paddy from dew and theft, as the lifting of stocks remains agonisingly slow, alleges former CM

title: Starbucks' cold brews ride the protein wave
description: Brands are introducing protein-rich products to meet growing health consciousness in India. Starbucks now offers protein-infused cold foam for iced drinks. This move aims to integrate wellness into daily routines. A standard iced coffee already contains significant protein, and the added foam boosts it further. Starbucks is also providing zero-sugar options. This trend targets health-aware consumers who value their lifestyle.

title: West Bengal remains destination and source of Bonded Labour
description: Poor workers from Bihar, Jharkhand, and Odisha work as bonded laborers in brick kilns, while the State is also source of youths who end up being bonded labourers in Chennai’s jewellery manufacturing units

title: Read, think, don't scroll: PM Modi recalls learning from TOI in Pariksha Pe Charcha
description: Prime Minister Modi emphasized the power of reading newspapers and discussing ideas, a habit from his student days, during Pariksha Pe Charcha. He cautioned against technology's overreach, urging students to use AI as a guide, not a replacement for learning. PM Modi also advised on exam preparation, rest, and avoiding comparisons, highlighting that small habits build a developed nation.

title: Indore water contamination: Inquiry panel issued public notice to seek evidence
description: The panel has been tasked with investigating the causes of water pollution, administrative negligence, action against responsible individuals, loss of life, medical effects, and remedial measures

title: Oil strategy guided by national interest: Foreign secretary Vikram Misri
description: India's oil sourcing strategy will prioritize national interest, avoiding dependence on any single country, stated Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri. Petroleum companies make purchasing decisions based on market conditions, availability, pricing, and risk assessment. The government's primary goal is to ensure adequate, reliable, and fairly priced energy for Indian consumers.

title: Delhi High Court seeks CBI stand on Jaideep Sengar’s plea for extension of interim bail
description: The brother of expelled BJP leader, who was awarded a 10-year jail term in the case by the trial court, said his interim bail was expiring on February 11 and sought an extension as he was suffering from oral cancer

title: Won't let SIR be stalled, or genuine voters left out: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court firmly stated it will not permit any delays in the special intensive revision of voter rolls across 12 states. While extending a document submission deadline by a week, the court sought an affidavit from Bengal's DGP regarding alleged TMC efforts to disrupt the process.

title: Joan Laporta steps down as Barcelona FC president, to seek re-election
description: Barcelona FC vice-president Rafa Yuste will act as president for the next three and a half months

title: Banks must block suspect money transfers: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has mandated banks to implement AI for detecting suspicious transactions, issuing alerts, and pausing transfers until account holder verification. This directive follows the Home Ministry's report of nearly Rs 52,000 crore siphoned through online fraud. Justices emphasized banks' fiduciary duty as trustees of public money, urging them to prioritize security over profit.

title: Russia accounts for over 50% plaints by Indian students abroad: MEA
description: Russia has become a major concern for Indian students abroad, with over half of all global complaints regarding exploitation and racial discrimination originating from the country. Data reveals a sharp surge in such incidents, raising serious safety worries for students, particularly those pursuing medical education. Many fear reporting issues due to potential expulsion and visa complications.

title: 'Not right at all' to say Tamil Nadu was ignored in Budget: FM Sitharaman
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman refuted DMK MP P Wilson's claim that Tamil Nadu was ignored in the Union Budget. She highlighted several initiatives for the state, calling his allegations baseless. Wilson had argued that Tamil Nadu, a high-performing state, was being discriminated against in tax devolution and project allocation.

title: FM Sitharaman forgot last year's promises: Chidambaram
description: P. Chidambaram criticized the Union Budget 2026-27 in the Rajya Sabha, labeling it 'forgettable' for cutting capital expenditure. He highlighted stagnant capital investment, a collapse in net FDI, and withdrawing foreign portfolio investors, questioning the government's reform momentum. Chidambaram noted a decline in nominal growth and a lack of private investment despite companies holding significant cash.

title: Our strategic oil reserve can last up to 74 days: Puri
description: India's strategic petroleum reserves can currently cover 74 days of demand during global crises, according to Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri. While the International Energy Agency recommends 90 days, Puri expressed confidence in the current level, noting potential for future increases.  This reserve is crucial for economic stability and energy security as India experiences rapid growth.

title: EC allegations on SIR: SC asks Bengal DGP to file affidavit
description: The Supreme Court has ordered the West Bengal police chief to personally respond to serious allegations from the Election Commission. The EC claims ruling party TMC members are deliberately obstructing the revision of electoral rolls. The court emphasized the importance of constitutional laws and the EC's authority during elections.

title: Labour codes to enhance ease of living and doing business: Survey
description: A recent survey by VVGNLI reveals that a majority of workers anticipate improved working conditions, including better rest periods and income security, with the implementation of four new labor codes. Employers also foresee enhanced ease of doing business. The codes are expected to bolster protection for women workers and improve social security access and portability for various worker categories.

title: India okays $175m package for Seychelles, inks 7 agreements
description: India has announced a $175 million economic package for Seychelles, including a $125 million line of credit and a $50 million grant, to support projects in housing, health, and defence. The two nations also signed seven pacts, strengthening maritime security and cooperation in the Indian Ocean. This collaboration aims to enhance regional stability and counter transnational maritime challenges.

title: ‘BJP leader’ booked for beating woman in M.P.; video goes viral
description: Such instances are reported regularly; BJP leaders, drunk on power, are seen perpetrating atrocities against women, the Congress said

title: PSLV-C62 Mishap: Failure analysis committee to be formed soon
description: ISRO is forming a Failure Analysis Committee to probe the PSLV-C62 mishap. An internal data analysis committee is meticulously reviewing flight data, telemetry, and logs to pinpoint the cause. This investigation follows a previous PSLV failure, prompting a comprehensive review of the 33-year-old rocket. Future PSLV and SSLV launches are on hold pending these findings.

title: T20 World Cup: Pakistan eyes revenge as it takes on USA
description: The former champion scraped past the Dutch to get its campaign off to a winning start, while the Americans let India off the hook in their opener

title: Anaemia, blood disorders can distort diabetes test HbA1c results, says study
description: Any condition that affects the quantity, structure, or lifespan of haemoglobin — such as anaemia, haemoglobinopathies, or other red blood cell disorders — can distort HbA1c values and lead to misleading estimates of average blood glucose, the Lancet viewpoint article notes.

title: CPOs suspended for allegedly assaulting youths
Contempt plea filed against V.D. Satheesan
U.P. Budget Session: Opposition disrupts Governor’s address
Indian war heroes, gallantry awardees replace 246 British-era names in military zones
description: The Indian Army is renaming 246 roads, buildings, and facilities across its establishments to honor Indian war heroes and shed colonial-era symbols. This extensive exercise aims to reinforce a national identity rooted in India's military heritage, recognizing gallantry awardees and distinguished leaders. Notable renamings include Arun Khetrapal Marg and Abdul Hamid Vihar, reflecting a commitment to celebrating indigenous valor.

title: Fact check: Did Cardi B call Stefon Diggs 'a disgrace' after Super Bowl LX?
description: Many expected Cardi B to stay until the end of the game yesterday, the popular Grammy winner left midway, as fans were quick to notice that the two removed each other from their respective social media accounts as the New England Patriots witnessed a brutal loss against the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX. While this has sparked chaos, a screenshot of an alleged heated exchange between the two has sparked panic.

title: DMK MP moves privilege notice against Piyush Goyal
description: DMK MP Tiruchi Siva has filed a breach of privilege notice against Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal. Siva alleges Goyal shared details of an interim India-US trade deal during a press conference while Parliament was in session. The Rajya Sabha Chairman stated he would review the matter, noting Goyal had already made a statement in the House.

title: Rahul has no interest in meaningful debate: BJP
description: BJP MP Anil Baluni called it the “height of irony”, that “a party which signed an MoU with the Communist Party of China now seeks to lecture the nation on security”.

title: Govt. gets NHRC notice seeking report on missing person cases
description: Citing media reports of over 800 cases filed in first fortnight of January, commission seeks detailed report within two weeks

title: Working towards enhancing quality of healthcare services in Delhi govt. hospitals: CM
description: Gupta unveils new facilities at G.B. Pant Hospital, says they will benefit patients from Delhi and other States

title: ‘Bhajan clubbing’ to book launches: DU to host its first literature festival
description: The festival will be held from February 12 to 14 on the theme ‘Nation First: Unity in Diversity’

title: Five years after Myanmar coup, ‘Even hope has become a risk’
PM Modi's safety faced a threat from oppn MPs in Lok Sabha, reiterates Speaker
description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla defended his decision to advise Prime Minister Narendra Modi against speaking on February 4, citing grave disorder and threats from opposition MPs. He refuted claims of no danger, detailing how MPs used unparliamentary language, tore papers, and aggressively approached the PM's seat, creating an unsafe environment.

title: PM's Lok Sabha absence not due to any threat from us: Women Congress MPs to Birla
description: Congress women MPs accused Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla of making "false, baseless and defamatory allegations" against them under government pressure. They stated Prime Minister Modi's absence from the House was an "act of fear," not a threat from them. The MPs urged the Speaker to act impartially, highlighting alleged pressure from the ruling party.

title: Delhi HC extends deadline for schools to form fee regulation panels
Lessons about job creation from Misty Milk
description: The lack of access to affordable and reliable credit is one of the factors at the heart of India’s job crisis

title: A raid in a small town brings Trump’s deportations to deep-red Idaho
Delhi HC upholds termination of probationary additional district judge
Lok Sabha stalemate continues, oppn stalls House for 6th straight day
description: Parliamentary proceedings remained stalled for the sixth day as the opposition, led by Rahul Gandhi, clashed with the government over allowing specific issues to be raised. Opposition leaders accused the government of avoiding Budget discussions due to concerns about the Indo-US trade deal's impact on farmers. A resolution is anticipated for Tuesday.

title: PRR compensation sets precedent as landowners accept compensation voluntarily: DKS
Sharad Pawar hospitalised due to congestion, condition stable
description: NCP (SP) president Sharad Pawar was admitted to a private hospital in Pune with chest congestion. Doctors stated his condition is stable, attributing his fatigue to recent travel and engagements. He is expected to undergo a five-day course of antibiotics.

title: ‘Your head can weigh up to 60 pounds’: Doctor explains how screen height causes neck pain, headaches, and upper back tightness
Opposition mulling notice to seek removal of Lok Sabha Speaker
description: Opposition parties are seriously considering a no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, with over 100 MPs reportedly signing a notice. This move follows grievances over the handling of parliamentary proceedings, including the suspension of members and the refusal to allow Rahul Gandhi to speak. A final decision on the timing of the resolution is expected after further discussions.

title: Don’t let poachers sneak through
description: The Forest Department’s amnesty scheme must not legitimise illegal wildlife possession

title: Thunder vs Lakers injury report: Who’s in, out & questionable
description: Oklahoma City, leading the league, faces the Lakers in a crucial Western Conference clash on February 9, 2026. Both teams are hampered by key absences, with the Thunder missing Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and the Lakers without Luka Doncic. This absence will heavily influence rotations and offensive strategies, making depth and defense paramount for both sides.

title: HC judges cannot assume role of domain experts: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court cautioned High Court judges against acting as domain experts, emphasizing their role as neutral umpires in dispute resolution. The bench stressed that judicial review should not involve re-evaluating examination questions, urging High Courts to refer such matters to expert committees. This directive came while addressing a petition challenging a Jharkhand High Court decision on recruitment test questions.

title: Fifty years ago | Art treasures: strict registration soon
A hundred years ago | Empire wireless development
Operating and maintenance costs, Consumer Price Index among parameters to recalculate metro fare
description: Responding to allegations that the State government had sought the fare hike, the Deputy Chief Minister maintained that the decision had been taken much earlier by an independent fare fixation committee

description: Stories, technology platforms and digital markets are transforming humans into commodities

Regional course in emergency medicine and anti-doping launched
description: The course is being attended by 50 participants from multiple AFC Member Nations, including the Philippines, Malaysia, Bangladesh, Maldives, Sri Lanka, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Tajikistan, Bhutan, Nepal, and India

title: Endometriosis care needs a comprehensive approach
description: ICMR’s EndoCare India’s multidisciplinary approach can introduce a standardised screening guideline for frontline healthcare workers and health providers in primary care settings to recognise symptoms and refer patients to higher health facilities in a timely manner

title: Deworming pills to be distributed to children on February 10
Man held for sexually harassing college student, police constable
J&K: Omar Abdullah faces PDP fire over central loan scheme
description: PDP has slammed the Jammu and Kashmir government for availing the Centre's Special Assistance to States for Capital Investment (SASCI) scheme. PDP legislator Waheed Parra called it a "most dangerous scheme" and accused the National Conference of betraying its mandate by taking interest-free loans for capital investments, effectively mortgaging the state.

title: Centre has released ₹10,354.15 crore for CMRL’s phase II work, says Union Minister
description: Nearly 49% of construction work for phase II project has been completed, and there is no pending demand for release of funds, says Union Minister

title: Deputy Commissioner allows KSRTC buses to enter Mangaluru CBD
description: DM and Deputy commissioner H V Darshan said the move will encourage public transport in CBD, allow women to avail Shakti benefits and students concession passes

title: Hosur airport not recommended to prioritise defence projects of national importance, says Civil Aviation Minister
description: He was responding to a question raised by DMK MP S. Kalyanasundaram in the Rajya Sabha on whether the Centre has examined the Hosur airport proposal sent by the State government and the reasons for the delay in granting in-principle approval, airspace clearance and other such permissions

title: Chief Secretary holds meeting to monitor avian influenza in Chennai
description: Following the reports of avian influenza, GCC has examined the caretakers and people working in a park for respiratory infection

title: ‘Lack of co-ordination, old practices posing challenges to DMK alliance’
Oil rises after US urges caution for vessels traveling near Iran
Industrial Relations Code must balance job security in the AI era
description: The government must monitor labour-market conditions, retain the option of discretionary intervention, and temporarily expand the coverage of employment-protection provisions if a surge in job losses so warrants

title: Fake notes transaction leads to drug haul, arrest in J&K
description: Samba police apprehended a drug peddler after he attempted to deposit counterfeit currency. Investigations stemming from this incident led to the seizure of approximately 1.9kg of a cocaine-like substance, valued at Rs 19.4 crore. The suspect, a driver by profession, confessed to a long-standing involvement in cocaine sales, with the recovered drugs found in a factory garage.

title: A chance for India to polish the Kimberley Process
description: As chair of the Kimberley Process for 2026, and lead member of the Global South, India can steer meaningful reforms in global diamond governance

title: Chennai Metro Rail completes tunnel from Light House to Thirumayilai for phase II project
description: he TBM passed below 151 buildings including Light House, All India Radio, Russian Embassy, Dominic Savio School, Rosary Church, and St. Raphael’s School

title: Back on track: On Malaysia-India ties
description: India and Malaysia have set about repairing ties during Prime Minster Narendra Modi visit

title: Hyderabad and Cyberabad traffic police book over 900 drunk driving cases in special drives
Stifling ideas: On Ghooskhor Pandat and FIR
description: Sentiments cannot be allowed to trigger a criminal process against art

title: Purported Nancy Guthrie ransom note deadline approaches as search enters a second week
Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell declines House testimony, seeks Trump clemency
description: Ghislaine Maxwell, serving a 20-year sentence for sex trafficking, refused to answer questions from a House Oversight Committee. She invoked her Fifth Amendment right, stating she would only speak if granted clemency by US President Donald Trump. Maxwell's lawyer indicated she is prepared to share "unfiltered truth" if clemency is granted.

title: Indian coffee steadily moving from commodity-led  to quality, experience-driven market: Coffee Board
description: The tariff reduction from 25% to zero (0%) would boost India’s coffee exports in general and shipments of speciality coffees in particular, said the coffee community, in response to a media query on the impact of recent U.S. tariff reduction on India's coffee exports

title: TMC welcomes Supreme Court intervention in SIR exercise, calls it big victory for West Bengal
description: The ruling party in the State says the latest development blows apart the ‘ECI’s unilateral move to parachute micro-observers exclusively into Bengal to influence, intimidate, and manipulate the process’

title: ‘For him, get a little bit more aggressive; and for her…’: Expert reflects on Twinkle Khanna’s dating and friendship advice for son Aarav and daughter Nitara
T20 World Cup: Markram, Ngidi power South Africa to resounding win over Canada
Cavaliers vs Nuggets injury report: Who’s playing and who’s out
description: Cleveland Cavaliers visit Denver Nuggets on February 9th, a clash of conference leaders. Both teams face significant injury concerns, potentially impacting rotations and matchups. Cleveland aims to improve playoff seeding with strong defense and rebounding, while Denver seeks to maintain home advantage despite key player absences. Availability of stars like Jokic and Murray will be crucial.

title: Watergate revelations: Nixon asked China to interfere in India-Pak 1971 War
description: In his grand jury testimony, Nixon described a secret assurance given to Beijing during the war. His full statement reads: “The Russians were supporting India. … Nobody was supporting Pakistan because there was an embargo on the shipment of arms. … But we were giving moral support to them, and also we gave to the Chinese an assurance privately that if India jumped Pakistan and China decided to take on the Indians that we would support them.”

title: Starmer on way out? How Epstein revelations could lead to UK's first Muslim prime minister
description: Starmer is not accused of misconduct, and Mandelson has consistently denied any impropriety. Yet British politics does not operate solely on legal thresholds. It operates on perception, timing and instinct. The renewed attention on Epstein has revived a broader unease about elite networks, proximity to power and the sense that some figures are insulated from consequences. In that climate, Mandelson’s return has become a liability rather than an asset, raising uncomfortable questions not about guilt, but about judgement.

title: Are taxes on cigarettes adequate to deter consumers in India?
description: The latest taxes on cigarettes in India make up just 53% of the retail price, far lower than WHO’s 75% benchmark

title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers eye $186m Bucks star to join LeBron & Doncic
description: Trade speculation is intensifying around the Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo in the 2026 offseason. A hypothetical framework involves a package of Austin Reaves, Rui Hachimura, Dalton Knecht, Adou Thiero, and multiple future draft picks. This move would create a star-studded trio with LeBron James and Luka Dončić, aiming for immediate championship contention.

title: Travis Kelce felt 'awkward' with Blake Lively & Ryan Reynolds, reports say

Just a few hours ago, an insider has claimed that Travis Kelce reportedly felt uncomfortable while hanging out with the Hollywood power couple and is now pretty concerned about Taylor Swift.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
description: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts and a commitment to end partnerships with agencies they accuse of human rights abuses.
